TopicTitle: The Kerbal Missile Challenge! (Remake of an older tread)

Articles.Content:
Note: this challenge has not been completed, as in, I haven't put all the details in. You can still enter the challenge.

On the 18th of September 2013, Tommy99534 set us all the challenge of making an ICBM - Inter-Continental Ballistic Missile. The challenge recently became on the front of the challenge page again, however someone mentioned that it was around 8 months old (it's actually 10, but whatever) This challenge will be based off that challenge to fit with the recent updates - 0.22, 0.23, 0.23.5 and 0.24. I also consider the challenge to lack some details.

The Kerbal Missile challenge remake!

Back-story... (mission control text, perhaps?)

The Kerbals are at war - across the entire planet. The war only recently broke out, but technology has only given them missiles as weaponry. And the kerbals can't be bothered to go and find other ways to fight. The kerbals at KSC wish for you - yes, YOU! -to develop missiles capable of hitting other continents and destroying bases owned by the karbals - kerbals who are fighting against you. They are on all continents except for yours. You must regain these continents to gain superiority over the karbals!

Details

There are two categories for entry:

-Kerbin

-Interplanetary

As the names suggest, the Kerbin category aims to have a missile impact one of the other continents (map will be provided soon). The interplanetary category requires the missile to reach another celestial body - such as the Mun or Duna. The rules for both will be mentioned later on.

It is recommended that you do this in sandbox, but you can use career mode for a sub-category: cheapest missile.

General rules:

- No cheating through the debug menu (no infinite fuel, hacking gravity, ect.)

- All ICBM's must be unmanned

- Certain mods are allowed. Ask before use, but you certainly can't use hyperedit.

Kerbin category rules:

-The missile must reach at least 50km, but can't go over 200km

- Accuracy is important - you can't land in the ocean (however, you can put a boat in the ocean and get within 100m to qualify)

- Each continent has different points based on difficulty, which is determined through distance and size.

Inter-planetary category:

- The missile must land on a celestial body other than kerbin

- Points are generated through distance (more distant objects give you more points)

- You do not need to accurately hit a target, but getting close to an Easter egg on any object gives you a bonus.

Career mode:

If using career mode, the cheaper craft wins. Each category has this as a sub-category.

Leaderboards:

When you enter your results, I will determine your points. Be sure to show roughly where you landed on map view.

Launch vehicle must be manned, comand pods only, as it could be a long mission, and be capable of staying on station (staying all systems go) for long periods of time, to be a deterant for other nations of kerbin to attack.
